Question: Can I delete my old calendar history?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+RAIN_Flesh-Kincaid-Readability_BERT_: Yes, you can delete your calendar events one by one, by date range, or all at once by visiting the Calendar section in the Alexa app or on the Amazon website. You can also choose to have your calendar events older than 3 or 18 months deleted automatically.

Question: Do I have choice or control options for my contacts' information?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+RAIN_Flesh-Kincaid-Readability_BERT_: Yes, you can manage your contacts in the "Your Account" section of the website. You can add, update, or delete contacts. If you don't want Alexa to call or message your contacts, you can disable the feature in the Alexa app or website.

Question: Can I hide my email address?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+RAIN_Flesh-Kincaid-Readability_BERT_: You can manage your email preferences in the "Your Account" section of the website. You can choose to stop receiving certain types of emails, such as marketing emails, or you can unsubscribe from all emails. However, you cannot hide your email address from us, as we need it to communicate with you about your orders and other important information related to your account.

Question: I want to change my name.
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+RAIN_Flesh-Kincaid-Readability_BERT_: To change your name, you need to update your account information. You can do this by visiting the "Your Account" section of the Amazon website and clicking on the "Edit" button next to your name. Once you've made the change, it may take some time for Alexa to update her records.

Question: I want to edit my phone number.
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+RAIN_Flesh-Kincaid-Readability_BERT_: To edit your phone number, you can go to the "Your Account" section of the Amazon website and look for the "Contact Information" section. From there, you should be able to edit your phone number.

Question: Can you delete information about my time zone?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+RAIN_Flesh-Kincaid-Readability_BERT_: I'm unable to directly delete information about your time zone. However, you can manage your time zone settings in the Alexa app or on your device. Question: Can you delete my voice recordings?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+RAIN_Flesh-Kincaid-Readability_BERT_: Yes, you can delete your voice recordings one by one, by date range, by Alexa-enabled device, or all at once. You can also choose to have your voice recordings older than 3 or 18 months deleted automatically. If you choose not to save any voice recordings, we will automatically delete your voice recordings after we process your requests and all of the voice recordings currently in your Voice History as well.

Question: Are you sharing my age with others?
Title: Privacy Notice
RAG+RAIN_Flesh-Kincaid-Readability_BERT_: Amazon does not share your age with others unless it is necessary to provide you with a service or to comply with the law. Amazon also employs other companies and individuals to perform functions on their behalf. Question: Do you share my location with other people?

Question: How do you process my audio recordings?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+RAIN_Flesh-Kincaid-Readability_BERT_: When you speak to Alexa, a recording of what you asked Alexa is sent to Amazon's cloud for processing. Alexa uses this recording, along with other information, to respond to your request. Question: Does the assistant turn on my mic without my knowledge?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+RAIN_Flesh-Kincaid-Readability_BERT_: No, the assistant does not turn on your mic without your knowledge. The microphone on Echo devices is designed to detect only your chosen wake word. When the device detects the wake word, it turns on the microphone and sends the audio to the cloud to process your request. When the request is processed, the microphone turns off. You can also press the microphone off button to manually turn off the microphone.

Question: Is my calendar stored on the device?

Question: How can you guarantee my location information is secure?

Question: Is the information on my time zone stored?

Question: Do you store my voice recordings locally or on a server?
Title: Privacy FAQ
RAG+RAIN_Flesh-Kincaid-Readability_BERT_: Alexa is designed to process your requests locally on your device, but for certain features, Alexa sends audio to the cloud. For example, when you make a call or send a message or announcement via Alexa, or when you create a voice ID, the audio recordings used to teach Alexa your voice will be sent to the cloud. Text transcripts of your requests are also sent to the cloud so Alexa can respond to your request. You can review and delete those transcripts in your Voice History.
